headline: Estée Lauder Conviction Raises Questions On Compliance Risks And Valuation
summary: Estée Lauder Companies (NYSE:EL) was convicted in Canada for selling eyeliners that contained banned forever chemicals. The company was fined and added to Canada's Environmental Offenders Registry following the conviction. Estée Lauder is required to notify its shareholders of the conviction as part of its disclosure obligations. Estée Lauder Companies, which owns a portfolio of global beauty and skincare brands, now faces heightened scrutiny around product safety and compliance after the...
